snippet: A surveillance court rebuke of the agency in 2009 for violating its own procedures in analyzing phone records shows, again, the dangers in the data sweeps.
abstract: Editorial notes fresh trove of previously classified documents released by the National Security Agency reveals a surveillance court rebuke in 2009 for violating its own procedures for gathering and analyzing phone records; maintains documents provide further evidence that the agency has been unable to comprehend, let alone manage, its vast and continuing collection of Americans' telephone and Internet records.
lead_paragraph: A surveillance court rebuke of the agency in 2009 for violating its own procedures in analyzing phone records shows, again, the dangers in the data sweeps.
